byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: Friends and associates of former New York City Mayor Rudolph W Giuliania say his comments suggesting that Pres Obama does not love the United States stem from his horror at what he views as listless approach to terrorism and the Middle East; comments were latest in a string of similar public statements, and while ideological flavor is new, they are in keeping with his long history of having combative demeanor.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Giuliani, long prone to flamboyant confrontation and rhetorical excess, is less inclined toward self-restraint than ever.

headline.main: In Remarks on Obama, Rudy Giuliani to the Core
headline.print_headline: In Remarks on President, Giuliani to the Core

snippet: Mr. Giuliani, long prone to flamboyant confrontation and rhetorical excess, is less inclined toward self-restraint than ever.
